website_summaries.verdict: We love the price for this high-capacity flash drive, although the USB 2.0 may put some users off.
pros: Features an LED indicator and a slider so the end retracts into the housing for protection
cons: USB 2.0 will seem slow, particularly to those used to USB 3.0
Plastic housing seems a bit flimsy
Some users report problems with write-protection/read-only issues

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use for Non-Techies Like Me
customer_reviews.text: I'm a middle aged man who's never had a flash drive before and I couldn't be happier with how easy this thing is to use. I wanted to backup my pictures from my laptop and PC and it was as simple as plug in and drag and drop to to the flash drive. No software to install, directions to follow or formatting to be done. Exactly what I needed. I have over 4000 pictures loaded on this 64 GB flash and there's still over 20 GB left for more. I'm already getting another one to for videos now that I know it's this easy. If I can do this, anyone can.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: It is tooooooo slow! Do NOT buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 256 GB, It is tooooooo slow! Do NOT buy it. I have another 128 GB from the same brand bought it last year, it works fine, I could not figure out why this 256 GB is too slow to the extent I found it unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk Cruzer remains the best!
customer_reviews.text: A friend asked me to pick up a flash drive for her. I logged onto Amazon and glanced through the SanDisk Cruzers. They have been my go-to flash drives for years. Currently, I have a 256 mb, a 16 gb and now a 32 gb on my desk. I use all three in solving software problems on friend's computers. So I ordered the 32 gb for the friend and ordered one for myself as well. As always, they work instantly, perfectly and quickly. Great products!
customer_reviews.author: B. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Less Than 10mb/s Write Speed
customer_reviews.text: Super slow write speed; When saving a 72 gigabyte .zip file to this flash drive it was transferring at around 5 mb/s and it said it would take 5 hours 30 minutes to transfer. My computer supports USB 2.0 and in Windows 7, Device Settings I changed the setting to Performance [That did not increase the transfer speed]. Make sure you research what the Read and Write Speed is for any flash drive you buy. I recommend the Patriot Supersonic Rage 2 [400mb/s read, 200 mb/s write] or Magnum 2 [400mb/s read, 300mb/s write] USB 3.1 [which are backwards compatible to USB 2.0].
customer_reviews.author: James Limborg

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. FAKE ITEM
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to put 36.8gb of photos and videos in it but it said there wasn't enough space available. I was however able to fit 29.8gb. It is most likely a 32gb with the outside showing 128gb and the computer reading 128. However, when you try to use more than the 32 you get an error. Crazy how amazon allows this.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Another failure for the review section.. Avoid using this device for important data.
customer_reviews.text: Connected, backed up, and verified in June, when purchased. Went to access last week, and the same computer can't see it. Tried reboot, different computers, different USB slots, nothing. Waste of money. Most reviewers have no problems, but seeing the increasing negative reviews, there seems to be a trend I wouldn't trust this device with essential data. There are enough failures listed here to give you pause. And at $56, with no hope of an exchange, my advice is try another product. Why roll the dice?
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Pasquale

customer_reviews.title: Only 58GB usable out of 64GB
customer_reviews.text: The drive itself is OK to use but what irks me is that the drive is a whole 10% less than advertised. At first, I thought it was faulty and returned one to Amazon (as great as ever) for a new one. But that also formatted to the same capacity. Even after formatting to NTFS (which you should use as the default format method if you're not using a Mac), it still shows 58 GB. The included software takes up mere bytes. What is taking up a whole 6 GB on this drive ??? I needed 60GB minimum- now I have to get a 128 GB drive. NOTE TO SANDISK - DON'T ADVERTISE AS 64GB WHEN IT IS NOT 64GB.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: These work just fine and are quite durable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these memory sticks. One was for me and the other two were for each of my sons. We have all used ours and have had no issues at all with them. They seem fast enough for me to upload from and to download to and their capacity is correct. They are sturdy and have been used numerous times without any sorts of issues. These weren't very expensive but they are fine for most needs. I may buy a couple of more for things I want to store off the computer now that I see how durable and reliable they are.
customer_reviews.author: PattyTTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: I like these larges size SanDisk USB units
customer_reviews.text: I like these larges size SanDisk USB units. I use them when I am on any trip. I always take my lap top so after I take photos I download to my pc, then immediately transfer them to my USB disks. I have lost too many things. Now I don't. I take tons of photos whenever I go by a cemetery. After, downloading them it saves them until I can get home. I go through them a loy. SanDisk is the only brand I will use. I have had had to many malfunctions with some of the off brands.
customer_reviews.author: prijj

customer_reviews.title: Repair This Drive Message: second time it was used
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, however it is extremely slow to transfer files. Then, the second time I plugged it into the computer an error message appeared: "Repair this drive: We found errors on this drive. To prevent data loss, repair this drive now." I cannot believe it, but I suppose it's better to learn the SanDisk Cruzer is faulty early on before I actually lose data. I'll never trust it, so it was a waste of money. I have many SanDisk products and have never had a problem until now.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Slow, slow, slow
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the slowest flash drives I've used! I swapped it with another flash drive and it was almost 3 to 5 times faster. I tried different ports and reformatting the drive and nothing helped. I guess a should have read the reviews that tested the speed and I would have found this out before I ordered it. It's going back...
customer_reviews.author: MikeF

customer_reviews.title: Spend an extra dollar and get something that works right off the bat.
customer_reviews.text: The price was decent. For my computer running Windows 7 Professional, it wasn't plug and play. Requiring the user to go online and find a driver for a flash drive this day and age is a little ridiculous. Going into device manager and having it auto search for drivers yields no results.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: It's sad when I have much older 2g uSD cards that ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these for USB RAID testing. Writing to these things is SLOOWWW... even in a RAID stripe. Running across reviews on another site, this seems to be a very common problem with SanDisk, which is disappointing. Even doing a raw /dev/zero in linux returns a slow write speed. It usually takes around 45-50 minutes for a full blanking pass. I've tried different file system options and such for write block alignment, but nothing really helps. It's sad when I have much older 2g uSD cards that can out perform these. I guess the next time I'm buying USB flash storage, uSD with known and (supposedly) guaranteed rates is the way I'll go.
customer_reviews.author: Brett E Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy SanDisk Cruzer 64GB
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this before you read the reviews! I realized that this simple and "used to be" perfect devise is now loaded with extra garbage that "keeps your files safe" - rather, keeps them from you using them. All that does is make this small storage devise useless and too much of a pain even to try wading through the online setup instructions. It also robs you of 8 MG of storage needed for their stuff. It was perfect before they added the extra stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Easy Way to Make Your Data Portable
customer_reviews.text: Thumb drives have been around for a while, and SanDisk is big name in that kind of storage. I realize there are other storage media, but I like the portability and ease of use. I don't have to log-in and download things, they're right there. They have a range of storage capacities, and the 32 GB is a lot for me, as I don't have many videos. Files, images, etc., can be stored in large quantities. It all depends on your preference, but thumb drives are viable storage options.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in PA

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This is a dangerous product, in the sense of... get ready to lose your data. I have purchased the same item twice but from different stores (amazon and a different store) and each time once I set up the security password it never and I mean NEVER accepts the password when you are loging in and keeps giving you an error that your password is wrong, there is no way to recover the data... so.. either data lost.. or... data lost and also lose the security feature of the usb.. its useless in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good reliable brand
customer_reviews.text: I now keep critical records on this kind of drive and make 4 backups after each update. This way I can move to use the handiest PC available AND since all PCs eventually fail I don't have to worry about hard drive backups for the data. Yes I do have multiple legal copies of Microsoft Office on my PCs, so moving around is easy. I have had very good luck with this brand, have a number of these (and other brands) and none of this heavily-used brand have ever failed. Happy with seller too.
customer_reviews.author: GAH

customer_reviews.title: Best brand flash drive out there
customer_reviews.text: Unlike some other brand products out there, these work fine. I have a couple dozen SanDisk flash drives, some many years old. I have never had any problems with any of them, unlike another brand with a well known name. They are a great way to store seldom used data in a small place and keep it off your hard drive. I also use them to transfer data from one computer to another and to play music in my car. I won't buy any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: JunkyardDog

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: I saved two entire school semesters worth of work on this thing. I followed the instructions to a "T" and created a password as instructed. I wrote down and stored my password safely with all my other passwords. Then one day, this little Sandisk gizmo decides my password is no longer valid! Whaaaat???? I never changed it! I contacted customer service which turned out to be a useless venture as they just regurgitated the instructions on how to apply a password! So now all my precious work is locked in this useless piece of garbage forever unless I can find a good hacker.
customer_reviews.author: WickedQueen

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It's a usb drive. It is 2.0. It works. The intended use for this was a PlayStation Classic that I softmodded. Loaded games, and boom! Now the PS Classic has games worth playing.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Schuetz

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I wish it wasn't made of cheap plastic but I think it's a good value for the price. I did the slow format (don't really trust anyone these days) and it definitely had the space it was advertised for. The only thing is I wish there was an easy way to put a cord on it or that it would come with it. The fitting for that is VERY tight and I have to find something skinny that will fit in it. That is the only drawback and, in my opinion, a small drawback.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Coy

customer_reviews.title: What companies format flashdrives over 32gb to fat32?
customer_reviews.text: i was skeptical at first when i plugged into my computer seeing it at fat32 when anything over 32gb is by standard to format them to exfat. but i ran it through a storage quality check see if it had real storage and it does and this is the results. Test finished without errors. You can now delete the test files *.h2w or verify them again. Writing speed: 10.2 MByte/s Reading speed: 15.4 MByte/s H2testw v1.4 so even though formatted to fat32 it passed the quality check and would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not so reliable
customer_reviews.text: I transferred all of my photos and videos of family and friends from the past decade. Everything seemed to transfer perfectly. However, next day I opened the usb only to find everything was gone, completely empty!!! I’ve tried everything I could to recover those pictures/videos to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware that the password can change on its own or not recognize the one you create
customer_reviews.text: i have been using this along with 3 other sandisk cruzers all with the same password. i used this one last week to backup a file with the same password. today i put it in and it says password not correct. i checked caps lock and all that and chatted with sandisk. he had me remove files and reload files and it still didn't work. he then said sorry, nothing we can do to access the vault without the password. one might think i'm using the wrong password but i am 100% sure as the password always has been the same for all the sandisk usbs. Beware
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: This product was packaged very well and arrived in excellent condition. And they are most definitely perfect for my needs. I used each for a different genre of music in my collection and they hold the data very well and the playback is very clear and spot on. I use them in our Chevrolet Traverse and they make our road trips so much nicer. I will more than likely be ordering more for my other genres. I most definitely recommend this product to anyone and everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Advertised as as 3.0 USB but when product arrived, it was a 2.0
customer_reviews.text: I have a PS4 that has mechanical issues so needed to purchase a 3.0 USB flash drive in order to move my storage over before trying to repair it. So, I searched specifically for a 3.0 256gb, it came up in the search, item described as 3.0, paid for it, yet when I received the item, it was a USB 2.0 256 gb. I tried to use it anyway but received the error message on the PS4 that I needed a 3.0. I paid aver 30 bucks for this and was disappointed for the companies error.
customer_reviews.author: 3hursts

customer_reviews.title: So slow--can I bypass the encryption?
customer_reviews.text: I bought two flash drives, one Samsung BAR Plus 64GB and this one. The Samsung BAR was like an Explorer file folder. I just copied and pasted about 20GB at a time and it was super fast. In fact, it probably copied 20 GB in the time it has taken me to read a few reviews and write this one. Now, if I needed encryption and a password, or it was zipping files, maybe I'd tolerate a slower speed, but this is ridiculous! I want to find out if I can bypass the software interface. I didn't understand when I bought this that it was a special kind of flash drive that was so different from the others.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: A great buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use to store backup from older laptops. These little flash drives are a great bargain to use for that purpose. However, be aware that these are very low cost, so they're all lightweight plastic and very light in weight. They feel a bit flimsy, but they did work perfectly. I have backups to these backups, so if one backup quits working, I have another. I don't think I'd use these for flash drives I intended on using frequently, in case they don't stand up to repeated handling and use. They might be fine for that. I just don't know. But they were a great value for my purposes, and so far, they work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Bpollen

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.text: The product has some annoying features, but I was able to load all of my family photos for the last 12 years on there. It worked for a few months. Now when I go to open them - I receive an error message and none of my files are available. EVERYTHING is gone. I called customer support for assistance and I could barely understand a word they said and they were not helpful at all. Do not trust this product with your information. I have attempted many recovery programs and still have not been able to retrieve my photos.
customer_reviews.author: F.W.

customer_reviews.title: Great, but Slow
customer_reviews.text: For my intended use, this thumb drive is great. It has plenty of storage for transferring video and is portable, so I don't need to carry a big hard drive around. My only complaint is that the file transfer is pretty slow. While this is somewhat to be expected, I anticipated it would move a bit faster than some older thumb drives that I have from 10 years ago. Unfortunately, it runs about just as slow as the older ones. With that being said, it is certainly a good purchase and works well for transferring large files without the need for lugging a bigger, more expensive hard drive around.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to store files for later use.
customer_reviews.text: Whether you want to store video files, photos, personal documents, or work related material, this is a great way to do it. Very easy to use. Just plug it in, drag your files to the drive where it is located and let the chips fall so to speak. Seemed a tad slow, but then my machine is more than a tad slow. SanDisc produces an excellent product and this was a very good price. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: tharzill

customer_reviews.title: Easy Way To Back Up Photos
customer_reviews.text: A simple way to copy my photo files from my computer hard drive to this Flash Drive. Simply plug in the drive, open the folders and click and drag your photos/folders into the drive. Its not lightening quick and large transfer can take awhile but it's not like Im in a big hurry. I've used Sandisk before and they have been reliable. I usually do backups twice a year to make sure my back ups are current. Years ago I didnt back up regularly and lost some files that were irretrievable so lesson learned. The cost to storage capacity is good especially if you catch this item on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: Stock up on these
customer_reviews.text: With new systems coming without any CD/DVD/BRay, it is important to have a few of these in the drawer at all times. High quality, cheap, and in the minimal packaging that cuts out the hassle of freeing the USB from the store packaging made to reduce theft.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Bought SanDisk USB 2.0 because they are reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using flash drives for many years. I can't comment on the durability of this individual drive as I just got it, but a SanDisk drive has never failed me while in use. Speed was as expected for USB 2. I'm using these for archival backups so USB 3 speed isn't as critical as expense. Transferred 125 GB of files in one operation and lesser amounts in others. The device did not warm up in use. The Vault encryption would have added time to the operation. I only used it for sensitive documents. No point in encrypting family photos and home movies.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Beckey

customer_reviews.title: Not for people who struggle with computers
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure what I am doing wrong, but I am having so much trouble with this thing. I had a picture keeper that I got on a lightning deal and that thing worked great, but I saw this cheaper and I wanted to save my music too. I have tried 3x and when I check it out on another computer, nothing is saved! I'm following the directions, so not sure what I am doing wrong! I had my husband try once too. Now we are not tech savvy at all. We have just a little more than basic computer skills, so it probably is user error. That being said, I dont recommend for people like us
customer_reviews.author: Rickylala

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive is exceptionally good for those who want large amounts of data to work with, and are on a budget. If you are carrying files around for work or personal, you should have more than enough room on this to carry it all...even if you are transporting large GB level files. It's only downside is that you don't seem to get the whole 64 GB for the sandisk installer on there...but it's still more than enough to work with.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: 64GB?????
customer_reviews.text: Well i ordered two of these to add memory to my fire sticks and when i checked to see if they were 64GB they were only 58GB. So i asked myself will the 6GB missing be that big a deal for my needs? And the answer i came back with is no. Would i have liked to get the full 64GB? Yes i would have. Will i order them again? it's and 80% to 20% i would.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Super slow, great price
customer_reviews.text: the upload time on this thing is simply unacceptable! I get download times that are way quicker than loading files of similar size unto this disk. You get what you pay for, and with this product you aren’t getting much, because you aren’t paying much.
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: HOlds a lot of stuff
customer_reviews.text: I only use this product as a storehouse for music. It (as you would think) holds a whole lot of music, therefore it suites my need perfectly. In fact I'm listening to music right at this moment even as I write this review. And another plus is that no mater how much music I put on it, it's weight has not increased, making it easy to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Alan The Knower

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE ENCRYPTION SOFTWARE!
customer_reviews.text: This USB is great if all you want is mass storage for an affordable price. However, DO NOT use the encryption software! As soon as I did, I PERMANENTLY LOST all of my work I had transferred into their "vault" program. I was so desperate to restore these files that I even purchased a $40 file restore program. Not even that worked. I am incredibly upset. Please, for your own sake, DO. NOT. USE. THE. VAULT. SOFTWARE.
customer_reviews.author: daniel davila

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to add an ID tag
customer_reviews.text: I've had older SanDisk Cruzer USB drives. The older ones came with a circular metal ring onto which I could attach an ID tag. Unfortunately this one does not come with a circular metal ring installed. The attach point on the USB drive is so small it would require a tiny tiny metal ring. I had some replacement zipper pulls with nylon cords and even this was difficult to thread into and through the tiny attach point opening on the USB drive. If you need ID tags on your drives be aware of potential difficulty of attaching them to this style USB drive.
customer_reviews.author: Grayson

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and good quality, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of these installed in my props for my Christmas Lightshow. They are each installed into a Beagle Bone Black small single board computer, which are remotely installed in placed in my front yard. I have no complaints yet, but 64GB is adequate size for what I am using them for. I possibly could've used 32GB, but opted for a slightly larger drive. Also, love the frustration-free packaging, as I hate cutting open those plastic containers. These were in cardboard packages that were quick to open.
customer_reviews.author: Stanward S. M. Oshiro

customer_reviews.title: "unexpected error" preventing photo transfers
customer_reviews.text: Installed about 80gb onto this 256gb thumbdrive...but now, it will not accept any more, constantly posting "an unexpected error....see code below" sort of message. So, its not doing the job. I tried the analysis and repair feature on my Win10 PC. Says nothing is wrong. Hmm. Well, its not working as advertised so back its going.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Failed in 10 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thumb drive to use with the "dash cam" recording function of my Tesla - that is, to record footage during drives and while the car was parked. The drive failed within 10 weeks. SanDisk says the drive CANNOT be used for that purpose- that only a high-endurance drive that allows continuous video recording can be used, and SANDISK DOES NOT MAKE SUCH THUMB DRIVES.
customer_reviews.author: pf

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk Cruzer CZ36 64GB USB 2.0 Flash Drive - Great Product
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about a flash drive. They either work or they don't. I have purchased several of different sizes and keep returning to SanDisk because they have always worked. Love the 'Frustration Free Packaging' and generally hate these plastic blister packs that require entrance into Ft Knox to get the product out.
customer_reviews.author: Al H.

customer_reviews.title: Bait & Switch with a proprietary app that doesn't allow you to simply copy files with windows.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to use the "encryption" feature. It's useless and proprietary. Don't wast your money on this, find something better. All the included watered down app does is try to up-sell you on a real encryption solution. You can just configure the device with a password and copy files to the 128-bit encrypted device. No, you have to use their app to actually copy the files. The old devices this company made had a virtual CDROM that you could run, and it would simply ask for the password. Not anymore...
customer_reviews.author: Technical Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Died in 4 months with minimal use.
customer_reviews.text: USB became "write-protected" in 6 months after only being used a handful of times. I bought this high capacity SanDisk USB to store and transfer files from my computer and my laptop when I needed to. I'm disappointed as I should have started using it as soon as I received it, but only opened and started using it when I needed it 4 months ago. After multiple attempts to fix the USB, multiple tech advise was that since it couldn't be formatted, better to just chuck it and get another one as I clearly received a bad egg. Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Good general purpose flash
customer_reviews.text: Great affordable usb flash drive for general use. I use to buy San disk flash drives during school days for massive projects and animations. I mainly bought this to add music and leave it in my cars media port. Build quality seems ok a bit weak in the push/pull slider but I can't say for sure since it will be mainly in my car. I would recommend sandisk for a affordable flash media but do be careful of the rise in fakes nowadays, also includes other name brands like Kingston and Samsung. Use H2testw immediately to spot for defects or fakes.
customer_reviews.author: SokiTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Love the slide away usb
customer_reviews.text: I can't comment on the technical specifications of this flash drive... it seems to do the trick! I am impressed , though, with the slide- away function and the light. It will flash on and off when the computer is doing something and it will fade on and off when it's in a standby mode. This is helpful for knowing if you're going to wreck your data by taking it out. For me the biggest thing was the value and the slide away. I have wrecked too many thumb drives because they break off the usb in travel. This is fully contained.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: great for converting DVDS to play in the car!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a big flash to back up our kids dvds. To put in perspective, I put 30 movies on this drive and it's only half full. I bought another one for just our DVD player in the car. Which is AMAZING. Never again do we need to pull our dvds out before a road trip and figure out which movie we are going to watch, we have them all in the car...which helps organizing and not worrying about the dvd or cases.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: "The disk is write protected" -- I can't transfer anything.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this USB to transfer files from my camera/GoPro while on vacation but when I transfer files, it tells me "The disk is write protected." and I can't transfer anything. I tried to reformat it but it tells me the same thing. Not a good thing to spend all this money and cannot use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, pay attention to the 2.0
customer_reviews.text: This is a USB 2.0 drive, that's really important to pay attention. The read speeds are around 11 mb/s and the write speeds are around 2.5 mb/s. It's miserably slow, especially when a USB 3.1 is only about $5 more and reads at 120 mb/s and writes at about 40 mb/s. At size like the 128 GB I have, it takes hours to write large files to it. I have to start the files then go to sleep. A 3.1 of the same size, maybe 10-15 minutes. If you are going to buy this thumb drive, save yourself the headache and just set a $20 bill on fire.
customer_reviews.author: Boyd

customer_reviews.title: WORTHLESS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this USB drive for my Tesla Sentry security and it worked great when I first got it. A few months later it stopped working and I can't see what the problem is because it became write protected. I've scoured the internet to clear the write protection and have tried several suggested solutions but it still won't remove the write protection or reformat. I've tried calling SanDisk's customer service line but they haven't been helpful. I'm throwing this piece of crap out the window - DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS
customer_reviews.author: 1Eques3n

customer_reviews.title: 64GB? More like 50 GB
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 64GB and a 128 GB and the 64GB only had 50 GB. That's like 13GB already gone. I use it for school but so for me it's not worth returning but jeez. These things are a hit or miss. I know the GB won't always be true to it's capacity because of internal storage but that's 13GB gone not like it's 2 or 3GB used.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Locks Itself. Can't Access
customer_reviews.text: It locked itself after the first use. I put a lot of family pictures for the digital frame and I went back to add more. Now I can't access the ones I individually picked to transfer to a better device. It's saying to Format Disk. If I format it then all the pictures will be deleted. I didn't even get to use half of the storage space. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Sol

customer_reviews.title: SO SLOW
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I have a dud, but this is too slow. The speed is never higher than 17MB/sec (formatted to NTFS, coping videos), but it keeps slowing down to 0MB/sec even while copying the same file. Copying the same data to a Lexar 32GB USB 3.0 is more than 4X faster. It's peak speed is around 50MB/sec, but it never goes slower than 40MB/sec. I don't know how much of that is due to USB 3.0 vs USB 2.0, but either way, I wish I would have spent a few dollars more and bought a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Overall good product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for use in my car. I love listening to a variety of my favorites, but I hate having to load CD's. And of course the obvious would be to use the bluetooth of my phone, but I don't like 'tying up' my phone for listening to music while I'm driving. The drive works fast, is compact (too compact since I lose it often) and easy to use. SanDisk is a known brand which made it easy to trust in the buying process. The retractable usb part does not feel flimsy when I push it out or pull it in.
customer_reviews.author: bakedziti

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: This little USB drive is working like a dream. I picked it up for my little photo frame that I got last year and it seems to be showing my photos just great. I am super pleased. The price wasn't too bad and I like it better than the SD card. I think the USB plug is a little more reliable than SD, that might just be my thinking but so far it seems to be the case. I have no problems with the quality. It's holding together just fine and it's been pluged in and removed a few times. I have nothing negative to add at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Kitana2

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is my *third* purchase of the SanDisk Cruzer 32GB USB 2.0 Flash Drive and each of them performs flawlessly and works as advertised. While I cannot comment on the data transfer rates, I can tell you it works fast enough for me (I use this drive to store and play/stream music files), and I am very satisfied with the way it functions. I also use it as part of my emergency computer system restore plan as well. This Flash Drive appears to be very durable and is an excellent value for the price, and I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Abdul-Raheem

customer_reviews.title: It survived the washer and dryer
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over two years now. It does its job. I'm writing a review now to say that I accidentally left it in my pocket and didn't realize until I was taking my laundry out of the dryer. It still works!
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: A nice backup flash drive
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive holds plenty of information as said. It is portable and small but the led is almost impossible to see with lights on. The write speed is slow but that is expected for 2.0. Overall for a cheaper usb for home use and backup, it will get the job done. Not the best, not the worst. The actual storage is 57.3 GB when formatted to exFAT which allows for much larger file sizes to be moved at once, and functions more like an NTFS than a FAT format which I like.
customer_reviews.author: Ravenclaw Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: USUAL EXPECTED SUPERIOR SANDISK QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive works as expected for Sandisk quality flash drives. Upload and download speeds are fast; date integrity is preserved as expected; no corruption of files detected. The only change I would make to the design is to remove the slider and make the usb connection rigid; the sliding usb connector sometimes retracts into the flash drive body when you are trying to insert the flash drive in-between 2 other usb connections and there is often not enough space to get your fingers into the small space to make sure that the sliding usb connector does not retract into the flash drive.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL R FONTENOT

customer_reviews.title: Average quality drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these a few years ago. Only 1 of them is still functional now. I use these monthly to backup critical files or transfer between computers. Unfortunately after a few months one of them was corrupted and could not be written to. Fortunately I was able to recover data off the drive but it was stuck in read-only mode. I suggest getting a higher quality flash drive for anything critical but these work well as disposable drives because of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Failed and burned my finger after six months.
customer_reviews.text: We had one of three fail after four months. Purchased Sept 2018, Failed Jan 2019. The device fails to show up as a drive when plugged into our late model Dell PC. When I removed it from the port, it was hot enough that the metal end burned my fingers. Fortunately we had most of the files saved elsewhere. Looked at the warranty form, that wants photos etc. Not worth spending 20 minutes to get back $12.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Virus included?
customer_reviews.text: No idea what was wrong with both of the high storage thumb drives but after transferring data both drives made the computer go crazy. nothing was working, screen jumped all over the place...removed drives immediately and computer recovered...Whew! That was close. Shocked that this happened with a Sandisck product.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice after converted to NTFS
customer_reviews.text: Good amount of storage but if you want to transfer files larger than 4 GB you will need to convert this flash drive from th FAT32 format that it comes in to NTFS format which is limitless for file size tranfers. Just remember that if you convert it you can't convert back to FAT32
customer_reviews.author: CRazz

customer_reviews.title: USB broken after two years
customer_reviews.text: i bought this jump drive 256 gb on august 2018, this jump drive its conected all the time to a liksys router as a backup unit, so the problem its no related to bad manipulation, and today i find out the usb its not anymore on the network, and its broken. try to fix it on many PC and laptop even with mac, in fact thanks to mac os i was able to recover all the important info. But the memory not anymore usable. after only two years of use. I have memories with more time of been use and still working. Bad quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tedjen

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working right after I used it the 3rd time
customer_reviews.text: I added some photos and files into it and the password worked just fine until I tried to open it a day later. I was unable to open it because it no longer recognized my password. It was a dismal failure. Glad I backed up most of the files and photos before it crashed. Sad to say I can't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I have used this flash drive now for a couple of years, and it has seen hard use moving between briefcase and PC. It has never lost data or malfunctioned. The LED indicates that it is inserted properly. I cannot comment on data transfer rate (but it seems perfectly adequate for large file transfers) but its capacity and durability make me recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Mordes

customer_reviews.title: Compact flash drive 64G
customer_reviews.text: This is a compact design, especially with the retractable plug. It fits nicely into USB ports even sandwiched between other devices on a multi-port hub. The red plastic handle is translucent and there's an activity light that lights when it's connected to the USB bus. As far as I can see the rate of flashing is independent of any activity that's going on. It flashes constantly at a rate of about once per second. Still nice to know when it's connected. Transfer speeds are fine for my use (synchronizing files between the computer and flash drive). I haven't measured it but it seems neither too fast nor too slow. Time will tell how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT for Mac
customer_reviews.text: If you're planning on using this with a Mac make other plans. Nowhere in the description does it mention you have to download some weird file if you have a Mac. i tried downloading the file but all it did was hang my computer and I had to do a restart. Plus, you have to completely destroy the packaging to get the drive so you can't return it, and the writing telling you if you have a Mac you're S.O.L is so small you practically need a microscope to read it. I don't know how well this works with a PC, but I do know that I can't use it and it's just a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Sobo

customer_reviews.title: Sneaker-net device
customer_reviews.text: This little flash drive is handy for transferring files from one system to another, or storing a large amount of data for a certain kind of use. It is much more convenient than an external hard drive, for uses where huge capacity is not needed, but it does have as much capacity as the hard drives in some notebooks! Not requiring a cap is another convenience, and the narrow form factor allows use in systems where USB ports are close together.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great Item. Works on my desktop and on my laptop too
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought the SanDisk Cruzer Glide CZ60 256GB USB 2.0 Flash Drive - SDCZ60-256G-B35. It worked for my laptop,but not on my desktop. I kept getting a error message that the drive had to be formatted. Upon doing the formatting, I got a message that the drive could not be formatted. For some reason the system was unable to read the drive. No such problem this time though. This one works perfectly in both computers. The other one must be defective.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Heiler

customer_reviews.title: SSSSLLLLOOOOWWWWWWWWW
customer_reviews.text: After spending a few HOURS transferring files to this flash drive very very very painfully slow, I get an error. File to large for transfer?? Yeah so anyways come to find out this flash drive is formatted FAT32 which means any files larger than 5gb cannot be stored on this flash drive. Isn't that just great news. So now I have to spend another few hours transferring all the files that are on the flash drive back to my computer just to reformat the flash drive.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Great little flash drive.
customer_reviews.text: There is not a lot to write about a flash drive except that it works as expected with no errors. It's USB 2.0, so not as fast as USB 3.0 but I didn't need it to be. I use this as extra, extra back up for my precious photos. In case my computer crashes, external hard drive blows up, and cloud storage gets targeted by hackers, I have this baby to keep me safe.
customer_reviews.author: GuinnessChris

customer_reviews.title: Easy-Peasy
customer_reviews.text: I had never owned a flash drive before I purchased this one. I bought a new computer and needed an easy way to transfer all my photos, documents and important files from my old computer to the new one. This SanDisk Cruzer accomplished the task quickly and without any problems. It's amazing how much data can be stored on something so small -- it measures just 2.25" x .75" x .38". And the cost of one of these gadgets is amazingly low!
customer_reviews.author: David Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Randomly can't access my files
customer_reviews.text: I was able to download one thing onto this flash drive before it completely let me stop accessing it. Instead of showing up as a drive it's now showing up as a "device" and now I can't access anything I downloaded on it. I saw someone else say theirs went into a "write protected" mode permanently, and I'm starting to think that's what happened to mine. What I downloaded onto it was very personal so I don't want to return it, but at the same time I want my money back. I would recommend never buying this!
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: First unit was defective, would not let any files ...
customer_reviews.text: First unit was defective, would not let any files to be written to the drive, which is kind of the point in buying a flash drive. I tried to get support from SanDisk, they seemed unaware of how to fix issue and suggested I "apply" for a replacement from them. Wait, I need to "apply" for a replacement for a defective product that I have only had for 5 minutes? The number of forms and information required was ridiculously complex and onerous. Thanks to Amazon, I simply sent the unit back and received a replacement with the click of a mouse. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeFan

customer_reviews.title: So much capacity in such a small package
customer_reviews.text: I actually carry this on my key chain - and use it fairly often. There's not much to say, really. This has huge usable capacity, the slider mechanism is dependable and it just works. I don't bother measuring transfer speeds for flash drives: they aren't designed for speed. This one is slow, but not anywhere near a point where I wouldn't use it. One potential problem I've had with other Samsung Cruzer drives is that they have a tendency to fall apart. Literally. The side panels have fallen off three of my Cruzer drives. They're still usable, but I haven't found a way to securely re-affix the panels. Jerry
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Saperstein

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when purchasing.  This is a USB 2.0 drive
customer_reviews.text: When searching for a flash drive, I filtered to only show USB 3.0 drives to ensure I was comparing apples to apples. That did not help here, since this drive was improperly categorized as a USB 3.0 drive. The product description is correct, but it's still coming up in results that are supposed to filter out USB 2.0 drives. I know, I know, read carefully before you buy, but the whole point of having a filter is so that you don't have to scan the descriptions carefully for what should be a routine purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Subtle Matter

customer_reviews.title: Slow transfer rates but very affordable
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 128 GB model and I use it to upload movies and TV shows to watch on our ROKU. I love the affordability of this flash drive ($20.99) and it’s got more than enough space for us. The only knock is that this drive is only USB 2.0 so the transfer rates are pretty slow. For reference, it takes me about 10 minutes to transfer 4 GB of files. I was fully aware when I purchased that it was 2.0 so there’s no need to deduct a star. I will update this review if the item ever fails.. If there is no update, it has worked as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Tim D.

customer_reviews.title: Not cleaned off prior to being sent, could have posed a risk for an innocent person, i.e. Identity Theft!
customer_reviews.text: It works, but it came with someone else's information on it! So it was previously used but we only paid $4.00 for it so can't complain too much! We deleted all the prior information and it works perfectly. Someone should have taken the time and cleaned it up before sending it, I am not sure if it had private information on it as we don't steal peoples information we just highlighted and deleted but if a criminal had gotten his hands on this and it did have someones private information then that could have posed a problem for some innocent person.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Tuggle

customer_reviews.title: Great Flashdrive
customer_reviews.text: Im so happy that I bought this flash drive! My computer & phone are the only place that I have all of my kids photos and Im always so scared something will happen to them & I will lose them forever. I had a few flash drives at home & none of them even held a fraction of what I have so I bought this and it holds them all with PLENTY of room to spare! It is very easy to use and I have had no issues with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Reed

customer_reviews.title: Its a Cruzer...what else do you need to know?
customer_reviews.text: These things have a great reputation and they've earned it. To me, the mark of a good thumb-drive is that you can plug it in, put stuff on it, plug it in somewhere else and upload whatever you put on it. It should be simple and this one is, plus it has a huge capacity, hasn't overheated or anything, and was a good price. I would buy another, but I probably won't have to for a while because 64gb is huge for powerpoint files.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Allen

customer_reviews.title: Sloppily Built
customer_reviews.text: Although the unit does store information, the slide on it is shakey and loose. When I try to plug it into the USB port, the tip wants to move backward. That's about it. I've had other Cruzer Flash drives and they still working fine, but they didn't have a movable head. I wouldn't buy this model again.
customer_reviews.author: FLRON

customer_reviews.title: Constantly shows lower storage amount
customer_reviews.text: So this is the first time I've had this issue with this brand. Initially it shows the correct storage. I copied something and all of a sudden the available & initial amount of storage was not reflecting properly. I had to look it up and reset it in windows and it was working again. I don't know if its broken but it happened 2x while using haven't used it since. I will not purchase this model again as this is unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: djdandylion

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Storage capacity is great for the price and super easy to use. I love the retractable USBs because it helps keep them safe from fall or bumping damage.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of paying for cloud storage and know it's not entirely secure so I bought one of these to see if it would hold all of my documents and pictures and it did with tons of room left. So I ordered another one and then I will have one off site and one at my computer. The first of every month I will back it all up to one and change it out with the one off site. That will save me $100 a year and I am in full control which is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Judy H.

customer_reviews.title: reliable memory but finicky mechanism
customer_reviews.text: I have used sandisk memory for years, and purchased sandisk cruisers many times. The one I received recently does not seem as wel made as those I previously pourchased. I had a difficult time getting it to open and close, and had to hold onto the sliding catch when inserting it in the usb port or it began retracting. I do not know whether it was a single bad drive, but it is not made to the same standards as the ones I purchased years ago.
customer_reviews.author: E.Swope

customer_reviews.title: Sandisk 64GB is NOT 64GB
customer_reviews.text: Last year I bought a 128GB Sandisk and I didn't use it until months later. When the time came to use it I noticed that the actual storage was in fact 32GB (even though it shows "128GB" on the casing); of course, I was out of time to return it. This time I ordered a 64GB and decided to check right away. It came with 57.2GB. I understand most storage devices do not come with exactly the amount of storage it says; however, I have never experienced such big difference (7GB) that's a lot! Anyway, I decided to write this review just so future buyers know what to expect.
customer_reviews.author: Amelfi22

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, affordable.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good 64GB flash drive. Unlike a number of these units, this one has a retractable male plug. Just push the red lever forward and it extends, pull the red lever back, it retracts where it's safe from damage. I've carried this with me and used it on a number of PCs and Chromebooks without any problem. This is a large capacity flash drive that works reliably. It's sold here on Amazon for a decent price. This is a 5-star product.
customer_reviews.author: Stone Dog

customer_reviews.title: 256 Gigs Of Back-Up In A Thumb Drive
customer_reviews.text: 256 gigs in a thumb drive! That's a lot of memory in a little stick! We are using 2 of these, on 2 different laptops, to back up our docs and pics (actually, everything except the program files). The Sandisk program that comes pre-installed lets you set up parameters for your backup operations (time of day to do it, how often, and so on). Both are working fine after a month or so that we've owned them. These would also work great, of course, to transfer large files from one computer to another, and so on. We think it's a great deal to get all this memory for $54 (at the time of this writing). Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dean Family

customer_reviews.title: decent drive
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these drives for a few times now, so i can not comment on longevity. I will say that I bought 2 of these drives because of a lightening deal. I gave the drive a 3 because they are light weight and feel cheap. I used them to transfer files between computers and got between 4.10 MB/s and 6.21 MB/s transfer rates. So to me, that is absolutely horrible. Both computers showed relatively the same speed. What i do like about the drive though is that there is a bar at the corner to hold a lanyard or something else, the drive tip which slides out locks well in the out position.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: USB drive didn't fit, but I found a workaround
customer_reviews.text: The USB drive didn't fit into the USB sockets in the front of my computer (Dell XPS 8930). I got around the problem by inserting a USB extension cable and then plugging the USB drive into that. It worked. The drive fits into the USB socket at the back of the computer. I'm not sure if this is a problem with the USB drive or my computer. Both are new. Whichever is at fault, it was a problem so I rated the drive lower.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Quality USB Drive for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I needed an extra USB drive to act as a Windows 10 installer for various computers I own during resets, sales, etc. I've generally had only positive experiences with SanDisk so I bought this drive based on price and the large amount of storage it has to offer. I was impressed by it's high read and write speeds and it met my needs perfectly. The paper packaging was easy to open and wasn't the usual plastic wrapping cheap items use that tends to cut you if you don't use scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Suchy

customer_reviews.title: Affordable large capacity USB drives
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an affordable USB drive that could handle some big files. These were very affordable and have stood up well over the months. Now, a caveat: my PC said that there's a problem with one of them, but for the life of me, I cannot find it; the drive works perfectly and Windows Defender can't find any problems either. I will continue to monitor it, but for now, I give a thumbs up for these drives...
customer_reviews.author: Beantown Jim

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: My first-ever flash drive (guess I'm a late-late adopter) so I don't have much to compare it to. However, it did the job, storing a bunch of music files. Came with password protection, which I didn't use, but I liked that it was an option.I Small and lightwe, which is convenient - and also easy to lose, so you might want to opt for a bigger one if things tend to get away from you. Didn't see any way to easily label it. Construction seems flimsy-ish, but I've always had good experiences with SanDisk products so I'm not too concerned. Can't really offer much insight on the speed, since I was transferring from an ancient PC.
customer_reviews.author: Tobrid

customer_reviews.title: Not a Geek
customer_reviews.text: Still, I have no concept of how to use this obvious and simple product. The four I have ordered remain in my office drawer awaiting two things: a reliable source of help to "learn me" how to use this 21st-century geek stuff. And where to discover and acquire how to label or "name" each disk allowing me to know which of the four I must inquire? As a long-time member of "I am not a Geek Club," when against the wall I often ask the assistance of my nieces and nephews for their kind assistance - often at a price, I might add.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Needed a USB 2.0 low space stick.
customer_reviews.text: Working on a server with USB 2.0 tech did not want to chance backward compatibility, with a minimum drive size configuration decided to buy this ram stick. SanDisk Cruzer 64GB USB 2.0 Flash Drive (SDCZ36-064G-B35),Black Transferred Proxmox ISO and Linux ISO on bootable media with this stick and had -0- issues with any transfer I completed. Did what it was supposed to do at maximum efficiency. Packaged well and arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: 64 GB VERSION TOTALLY UNUSABLE
customer_reviews.text: BRICKED - I failed to heed the warnings of others, but it is true that the 64 GB model will become write protected and unable to add any data. It happened to me after 1 minute in which time it loaded 1.3 gb of data. Also my data is stuck there and I must return it and my data with it to get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: elawlor

product_meta.title: SanDisk Cruzer CZ36 64GB USB 2.0 Flash Drive, Frustration-Free Packaging- SDCZ36-064G-AFFP,Black
product_meta.description: Capacity:64GB| Package Type:Frustration-Free PackagingExperience premium, reliable and secure storage with a Cruzer USB flash drive. Protect access to your private files with password protection and file encryption with SanDisk SecureAccess software and get the added protection of secure online backup (up to 2 GB optionally available) offered by YuuWaa. With up to 32 GB of storage, you can count on them to help you store plenty of pictures, videos, and other digital favorites wherever you go.
feature_bullets: Premium, reliable and secure storage for your videos, music, Photos, or other files
Protect your sensitive files SanDisk SecureAccess software included
Password protection and 128 bit AES encryption
Ships in certified frustration free packaging

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars34,218 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
